article.headline: Niagara 86, Fairfield 74
article.story: LEWISTON, N.Y. (AP) -- Juan Mendez scored 34 points to lead Niagara to an 86-74 win over Fairfield Thursday night. Mendez scored eight points during a decisive run in the final minutes of the first half. The Purple Eagles trailed 29-28 after an 11-2 Fairfield run but countered with a 15-2 run of their own to take a 43-33 halftime lead. Niagara (7-4, 2-1 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) maintained a double-digit lead for most of the second half. But a three-point play by Fairfield's Michael Bell at 4:10 and a Dewitt Maxwell layup 40 seconds later pulled the Stags within six, 76-70. Mendez, however, shut the door on a Fairfield (5-5, 2-1 MAAC) comeback when he hit a 3-pointer with 1:49 to play, putting the Purple Eagles up 82-72. Alvin Cruz had 16 points and 11 assists for Niagara, becoming the 10th player in MAAC history to record more than 500 career assists. David Brooks posted 10 points to surpass the 1,000-career point mark. Deng Gai led Fairfield's offense, scoring a career-high 28 points and pulling down 11 rebounds. Maxwell added 17 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
